intro: Murdannia angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf murdannia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Pontederiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in dense clusters. Native to wetland habitats in tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in moist, sunny environments. The plant has a short, rhizomatous stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
